SHARE.TITLE: Share Project {{project}}
SHARE.EXPLANATION: Anyone who owns the link can view, clone, but not edit the project. If 'Share publicly' is activated, the project will be displayed in all public lists.
SHARE.REGENERATE_WARN: The old link will become invalid after generating a new one.

WELCOME.TITLE: Welcome to Logigator!
WELCOME.TEXT:
Welcome to Logigator, the simple yet powerful online tool to build logic circuits for free.

Let's take a tour.

ZOOM_PAN.TITLE: Zooming and Panning
ZOOM_PAN.TEXT:
To begin with, we start by looking at controlling the camera.

You can zoom in and out by using your mouse wheel and pan by dragging with the right mouse button pressed.

PLACING_ELEMS.TITLE: Placing Components
PLACING_ELEMS.TEXT:
In order to build a circuit we need to place components. All Components that are available to be used are shown here.

Your own components will be shown here as well, more on that later.

To place a component, select it and click somewhere on the canvas.

WIRES.TITLE: Wires
WIRES.TEXT:
For a circuit to work, the individual components must be connected. This is done with wires.

In order to place wires on the canvas, use the tool above and drag them with your left mouse button in the direction you want them to go.

CONN_WIRE.TITLE: Connecting and disconnecting Wires
CONN_WIRE.TEXT:
Wires can of course intersect with each other.

To indicate if they are connected or only overlap, a dot is either displayed or not at the point of intersection.

Using this tool you can click on said intersections to connect or disconnect the associated wires.

SELECT.TITLE: Selecting components and wires
SELECT.TEXT:
With this tool, you can select multiple components and wires at once.

Dragging with the left mouse button will show a highlighted area in which all components get selected.

It is also possible to select individual components by clicking on them.

SELECT_CUT.TITLE: Select Cut
SELECT_CUT.TEXT:
There is also a special variation of the normal select tool.

With it only components that are fully contained in the highlighted area will be selected.
Wires that are partially selected will be cut of at the point where the selection ends.

This can be useful if you want to shorten wires for example.

ERASER.TITLE: Eraser
ERASER.TEXT:
The eraser tool can be used to remove components without highlighting them first.

In order to use it, drag over the desired components with your left mouse button pressed and everything under your cursor will be deleted.

TEXT.TITLE: Placing Text
TEXT.TEXT:
Sometimes it can be useful to place text on the canvas to label an important part of your circuit.

This tool enables you to place some text on the canvas wherever you like.
It works like placing any other element.

CUSTOM_COMPONENTS.TITLE: User defined Components
CUSTOM_COMPONENTS.TEXT:
One of Logigator's features is the possibility to create subcircuits and pack them in your own components. This can be done here.

After you created a component it will be shown under the 'User Defined' category on the left side of the screen, ready to be used.

SIMULATION_MODE.TITLE: Simulation mode
SIMULATION_MODE.TEXT:
All you have seen so far is the edit mode of Logigator, where you can design and build your circuits.

In order to simulate and test them you have to switch to simulation mode by pressing this button.

AND.NAME: AND Gate
AND.DESCRIPTION: Output is high if all inputs are high.

NOT.NAME: NOT Gate
NOT.DESCRIPTION: Output is high if input is low.

OR.NAME: OR Gate
OR.DESCRIPTION: Output is high if at least one input is high.

XOR.NAME: XOR Gate
XOR.DESCRIPTION: Output is high if an odd number of inputs are high.

DELAY.NAME: Delay
DELAY.DESCRIPTION: Output equals Input. Adds one tick delay to the signal.

CLOCK.NAME: Clock
CLOCK.DESCRIPTION:
Periodically sends a one tick long pulse.
Delay between pulses can be configured.

TEXT.NAME: Text
TEXT.DESCRIPTION: Text which you can place on the canvas.

TUNNEL.NAME: Tunnel
TUNNEL.DESCRIPTION: Works like a wire, but wireless. Every tunnel is connected to all others with the same id

ROM.NAME: ROM
ROM.DESCRIPTION:
Read only Memory.
Can for example be used in program code.

D_FF.NAME: D Flip Flop
D_FF.DESCRIPTION: Holds a state. State on (D) gets saved on rising edge.

JK_FF.NAME: JK Flip Flop
JK_FF.DESCRIPTION:
Holds a state. Set (J) to high to set and (K) to high to reset. Toggles output if both are high.
Triggers on rising edge.

SR_FF.NAME: SR Flip Flop
SR_FF.DESCRIPTION:
Holds a state. Set (S) to high to set and (R) to high to reset.
Triggers on rising edge.

RANDOM.NAME: Random Number Generator
RANDOM.DESCRIPTION:
Generates random data.
Triggers on rising edge.

RAM.NAME: RAM
RAM.DESCRIPTION:
Random Access Memory. Applies input on rising edge of CLK.
Set WE to high to write to current address and to low to read from current address.

BUTTON.NAME: Button
BUTTON.DESCRIPTION: Can be clicked to emit a pulse signal.

LEVER.NAME: Switch
LEVER.DESCRIPTION: Can be switched on and off during simulation.

LED.NAME: LED
LED.DESCRIPTION: Switches on or off depending on the applied input.

SEGMENT_DISPLAY.NAME: Segment Display
SEGMENT_DISPLAY.DESCRIPTION: Displays a binary input as decimal number

INPUT.NAME: Input Plug
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Place this where the inputs of your self-defined components should be

OUTPUT.NAME: Output Plug
OUTPUT.DESCRIPTION: Place this where the outputs of your self-defined components should be

WORK_MODE_DES.1: Selecting Elements, but cut wires off

COMPILE.CIRCULAR_DEP: Circular dependency in components. {{src}} must not include {{comp}}.
